Main_Event_Assessment_With_Annotation: The Kincade Fire was a wildfire that burned in Sonoma County, California in the United States. The fire started northeast of Geyserville in The Geysers on 9:24 p.m. on October 23, 2019, and subsequently burned 77,758 acres (31,468 ha) until the fire was fully contained on November 6, 2019.
Time_with_Annotation: The fire started northeast of Geyserville in The Geysers on 9:24 p.m. on October 23, 2019, and subsequently burned 77,758 acres (31,468 ha) until the fire was fully contained on November 6, 2019.

Total_Summary_Insured_Damage.Total_Insured_Damage_Assessment_with_ann: In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC), PG&E estimated a minimum loss of $600 million before available insurance.

Total_Summary_Displacement.Total_Displacement_Annotation: As the fire spread, by October 27, evacuation orders and warnings grew to encompass nearly all of Sonoma County, including about 190,000 people, making it the largest evacuation ever in Sonoma County.

Total_Displacement_Per_Country.Displacement_with_annotation: As the fire spread, by October 27, evacuation orders and warnings grew to encompass nearly all of Sonoma County, including about 190,000 people, making it the largest evacuation ever in Sonoma County.

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Displaceme.Displacement_with_annotation: On October 26, compulsory evacuations had been issued for 90,000 people.

As the fire spread, by October 27, evacuation orders and warnings grew to encompass nearly all of Sonoma County, including about 190,000 people, making it the largest evacuation ever in Sonoma County.

Location_with_Annotation.Geyserville: "The fire threatened over 90,000 structures and caused widespread evacuations throughout Sonoma County, including the communities of Geyserville, Healdsburg, Windsor, and Santa Rosa."
Location_with_Annotation.Healdsburg: "The fire threatened over 90,000 structures and caused widespread evacuations throughout Sonoma County, including the communities of Geyserville, Healdsburg, Windsor, and Santa Rosa."
Location_with_Annotation.Windsor: "The fire threatened over 90,000 structures and caused widespread evacuations throughout Sonoma County, including the communities of Geyserville, Healdsburg, Windsor, and Santa Rosa."
Location_with_Annotation.Santa Rosa: "The fire threatened over 90,000 structures and caused widespread evacuations throughout Sonoma County, including the communities of Geyserville, Healdsburg, Windsor, and Santa Rosa."
Location_with_Annotation.Sonoma County: "The majority of Sonoma County and parts of Lake County were under evacuation warnings and orders."
Location_with_Annotation.Lake County: "The majority of Sonoma County and parts of Lake County were under evacuation warnings and orders."
Location_with_Annotation.Middletown: "Lake county only had one evacuation order and that was the town of Middletown."
Location_with_Annotation.The Geysers: "The fire started northeast of Geyserville in The Geysers on 9:24 p.m. on October 23, 2019."
Location_with_Annotation.John Kincade Road: "The Kincade Fire was reported burning at John Kincade Road and Burned Mountain Road in The Geysers, northeast of Geyserville, California, at 9:57 PM on October 23, 2019."
Location_with_Annotation.Burned Mountain Road: "The Kincade Fire was reported burning at John Kincade Road and Burned Mountain Road in The Geysers, northeast of Geyserville, California, at 9:57 PM on October 23, 2019."
Location_with_Annotation.Soda Rock Winery: "The Soda Rock Winery in Healdsburg was destroyed and the Field Stone Vineyard was heavily damaged."
Location_with_Annotation.Field Stone Vineyard: "The Soda Rock Winery in Healdsburg was destroyed and the Field Stone Vineyard was heavily damaged."

Specific_Instance_Per_Country_Affected.Affected_with_annotation: As the fire spread, by October 27, evacuation orders and warnings grew to encompass nearly all of Sonoma County, including about 190,000 people, making it the largest evacuation ever in Sonoma County.
The fire threatened over 90,000 structures and caused widespread evacuations throughout Sonoma County, including the communities of Geyserville, Healdsburg, Windsor, and Santa Rosa.
Lake county only had one evacuation order and that was the town of Middletown.
